replies.body:
KDA plays a lot smaller role than CS and Vision, as well as average damage scores and average gold income.

It's all well can good to be 100/0, but if you only dealt 100 damage (literally ksing all those kills), then you'd still only get an A.

Also, those 3 deaths could have been spaced out over 40 minutes or over 3 minutes.

Exactly this.

People are to focused on KDA. There are many other factors that lead to an S:

Dmg dealt
Healing done
Wards placed
Wards killed
Objectives participated in taking
Total objectives taken
Amount shielded
Total CS
Total gold

Then you can look at KDA. Leaning more towards the Assists.

Its more about KP than KDA. If you go 21/3/7 its not as impressive if your team has an overall kill amount of 60. It would mean you were only in 28/60 kills which is less than 50%. You might as well have gone 1/0/5 in a game where you team has 12 kills.
Damage, vision score, cs, objective damage, damage taken. KDA is not the only factor.
